data.title: Investor Relations
data.meta_description: Spyrosoft is listed on the NewConnect stock market. Check our investor relations page to see our management board and financial reports.
data.text:
Spyrosoft is a group of companies providing consulting and software development services in segments including Automotive, HR Tech, EduTech, Finance, Geospatial, Healthcare & Life Sciences, Industry 4.0, Media and Robotics. The Group offers a one-stop shop approach as it operates within a wide range of specialities – from Enterprise and Embedded Software Engineering, AI/ML, Cloud and Cybersecurity, to HMI or Ecommerce, Low-code and CRM Platforms.

Spyrosoft is a global company with over 1500 specialists onboard and 15 offices in 8 countries. The firm has been included in the Financial Times ranking of 1000 fastest-growing companies for three consecutive years: 2021, 2022 and 2023.

Konrad Weiske, cofounder of Spyrosoft S.A., is a manager with over 20 years of experience in the IT industry. He has worked for such international firms as Siemens, Vodafone, IBM, Microsoft, and Intive. He also currently serves as vice president of Software Development Association Poland (SoDA). He is a graduate of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology.

Wojciech Bodnaruś, cofounder and CFO of Spyrosoft S.A., has been affiliated with the IT industry since 2008. He previously worked at PORR Polska Infrastructure S.A. and Intive. At Spyrosoft S.A. he is responsible for financial strategy, planning and control, and risk management for all group companies. He is an economics graduate of the University of Łódź.

Sławomir Podolski is a manager with over 15 years of experience in the IT industry. He previously worked for ISBAN, Sygnity, and Intive. At Spyrosoft S.A. he serves as COO, responsible for sale and delivery of services. He is a graduate of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology.

Sebastian Łękawa, cofounder of Spyrosoft S.A., previously worked for such companies as Crédit Agricole, Recrutia, iAlbatros, and X2. He cofounded SMT Software. At Spyrosoft S.A. he is responsible for recruitment and development of local offices of the Spyrosoft Group around the world. He studied at the Wrocław University of Science and Technology.

Krzysztof Kuliński is a graduate of the Wrocław University of Science and Technology. He has worked in IT since 1983 and is regarded as a pioneer in the development of the IT sector in Wrocław. In 2000 he was responsible for opening and subsequently managing the Siemens R&D Centre. He also gained professional experience working for many other international IT firms, such as Gemalto M2M, Research & Engineering Center, and GlobalLogic.

Andrew Radcliffe holds a BSc in computer science and an MSc, and also completed the IT Leadership Programme at Cranfield School of Management. In his long experience in the IT industry, he has worked for Pythagorus International, Astrium, Ordnance Survey, Benefex, and Codefix. In the Spyrosoft Group he currently serves as CEO of Spyrosoft Ltd in the UK.

Tomasz Krześniak is a graduate of the Faculty of Law and Administration at the University of Warsaw. He has been a tax adviser since 2004 and a member of the Warsaw Bar Council since 2010. He has worked at the National Chamber of Tax Advisers, AE Consult, Kancelaria Radcy Prawnego Prof. Witolda Modzelewskiego, Kancelaria Adwokata Jacka Brydaka, and Kancelaria Krześniak & Budzyński & Stec. He also serves on the supervisory board of Tenderhut.
